summary: Hackers stole the personal data of nearly 150 million people from Equifax databases in 2017. How did Equifax, a consumer reporting agency, respond to that event? Equifax said that it investigated factors that led to the breach and tried to identify and notify people whose personal information was compromised. In addition, three federal agencies that use Equifax services made their own security assessments and modified...
title: Data Protection: Actions Taken by Equifax and Federal Agencies in Response to the 2017 Breach
